etymology.description: 崾 (secluded/overhanging hill) + 岘/峴 (mountain pass) = place name describing a secluded pass.
etymology.interpretation: Likely names a spot characterized by a narrow, overhanging saddle or pass in hilly terrain. Both morphemes are topo-characters commonly used in Chinese toponyms.
etymology.simplification: 峴 was simplified to 岘 by simplifying the component 見 → 见; 崾 remained unchanged.

parts.english: secluded (in hills); overhanging hill; tucked hollow; winding slope
mountain pass; saddle-shaped ridge; hill neck; used in place names (e.g., 峴山)

examples.chinese: 崾岘镇位于甘肃省平凉市灵台县(崾峴鎮位於甘肅省平涼市靈台縣)。
examples.pinyin: Yǎoxiàn Zhèn wèiyú Gānsù Shěng Píngliáng Shì Língtái Xiàn.
examples.english: Yaoxian Town is in Lingtai County, Pingliang, Gansu Province.

examples.chinese: 我们经过崾岘，停下来拍照(我們經過崾峴，停下來拍照)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen jīngguò Yǎoxiàn, tíng xiàlái pāizhào.
examples.english: We passed through Yaoxian and stopped to take photos.

examples.chinese: 地图上标注为崾岘的地方多为山口或垭口(地圖上標註為崾峴的地方多為山口或埡口)。
examples.pinyin: Dìtú shàng biāozhù wéi Yǎoxiàn de dìfāng duō wèi shānkǒu huò yākǒu.
examples.english: Places labeled Yaoxian on maps are often mountain passes or saddles.
